body.p: Comparability was an important concept in both the 1989 Framework and Concepts Statement 2, but the two previous frameworks disagreed on its importance. The 1989 Framework stated that comparability is as important as relevance and faithful representation. Concepts Statement 2 described comparability as a quality of the relationship between two or more pieces of information that, although important, is secondary to relevance and faithful representation.
